basics.name: Matthew Sutton
basics.label: Backend Software Engineer
basics.summary: Implementing demanding features, required by both clients and systems. Attracted to performance critical elements. Interested in solving problems at scale. Employer of both KISS and Avoid Premature Optimisation. Whilst abiding to the Agile methodology.

work.name: Codeweavers
work.summary: Progressed into the lead position within the Digital Store platform, managing and planning the projects that the team backing the platform would be working on. Speaking closely to clients, ensuring all requirements were fulfilled, in a way that enhanced the platform, for not only them but all clients using it.

highlights.title: Personal Highlight
highlights.description: Migrating our Frontend architecture to have all assets hosted from AWS, reducing average latency by over 1 second. Then working on the migration of our Backend to AWS, currently focusing on the update of the framework from .Net Framework 4.7 to .Net 8.

highlights.title: Management
highlights.description: Taking on the responsibility of managing multiple developers within the Digital Store platform. Conducting monthly individual catchup's and ensuring the team is meeting the expected requirements. Whilst also taking an active role in recruitment.

highlights.title: Communication
highlights.description: Working closely with other companies within Cox Automotive, delivering combined products to our customers. Whilst also reaching out to providers ensuring that our integrations are delivering the best service for our products.

highlights.title: Tenders
highlights.description: Aiding the operations team to create and submit tenders for multiple used car locators internationally. Working through documents estimating required work to ensure our products can fulfill all requirements.

highlights.title: Internationalisation
highlights.description: Releasing our Digital Store into multiple new markets; UK, Norway, Austria and many more. All using the same platform with a personalised configuration, making the site their own.

work.name: Codeweavers
work.summary: Naturally moved into a senior development role in the Digital Store platform becoming involved in ensuring it was ready for the company's expansion into Europe. Expanding my abilities into Frontend technologies, aiding with projects that span across both areas.

highlights.title: Personal Highlight
highlights.description: Extending our Facet Search implementation to support counts against each available option. This required a re-architecture of the algorithm used and was done without impacting its performance.

highlights.title: Tenders
highlights.description: Ensuring the platform delivered the products required by a client, quickly developing sustainable features for demonstrations to prove the platform could fulfil their requirements.

highlights.title: Internationalisation
highlights.description: Developing our Digital Store product to a point it was ready for an international release. Releasing it in France first, being closely followed by another 27 markets.

work.name: Codeweavers
work.summary: Began to work on both the production and continuous integration (CI) platform as well as continuing work on client based projects.

highlights.title: Personal Highlight
highlights.description: Migrated the way one of our core applications stores and processes data reducing its memory foot print from 13.5GB to 6GB, whilst completely removing its usage of the Large Object Heap (LOH).

highlights.title: Continuous Integration
highlights.description: Increased our build throughput, developing the functionality of concurrent builds, for both related and un-related projects.

highlights.title: Continuous Deployment
highlights.description: Implemented the functionality of concurrent deploys for unrelated projects. Increasing our deploys per day by 100%.

highlights.title: Sustainability
highlights.description: Extended our implementation of Canary Testing to include the ability to replay requests for our core APIs during deploys and ensure the responses match within a defined tolerance.

highlights.title: Data Structures
highlights.description: Modified an existing word index, used to enable free text searching, to use a Trie data structure. This reduced indexing memory consumption by over 2GB at peak working set. Then further modified the structure into a Compressed Trie data structure which reduced the node count from 477,085 to 144,229.

work.name: Codeweavers
work.summary: Spent the 3rd year of my degree at The University of Derby as a placement student at Codeweavers.

highlights.title: Personal Highlight
highlights.description: Being offered a full-time role in the first half of my placement, with the final year of my degree funded.

highlights.title: Professional Development
highlights.description: Delivered a JLR project to help the upsell of Stock vehicles during a Build to Order journey. This was fundamental to me growing my confidence and understanding the complete journey of a project.

projects.name: Serve My Site
projects.description: Building a self-serve hosting platform for Web Applications. Focusing on providing immediate deployments and next level performance when serving the hosted applications.

projects.name: Portfolio
projects.description: Designing, building and hosting my portfolio site. Using the skills I've developed during my professional career to do so.

projects.name: Word Processing
projects.description: Attempting to reduce memory allocations during word processing.

projects.name: Word Indexing
projects.description: Attempting to reduce memory allocations and un-lock new natural language search features during word indexing.
